meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a vagabond.
meanings.sent1: The man's unkempt appearance and vagabondish lifestyle caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: She loved the freedom of her vagabondish ways, traveling from place to place with no fixed destination.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vagabondish behavior of wandering around the neighborhood made the neighbors chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His vagabondish spirit could not be tamed, always seeking new adventures and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a vagabondish charm, with its peeling paint and overgrown garden.

meanings.sent1: The group of friends went on a vagabondish road trip, sleeping in their car and exploring new places.
meanings.sent2: Her vagabondish nature led her to quit her job and travel the world with just a backpack.
meanings.sent3: The dog's vagabondish antics of digging up the garden kept the family entertained.
meanings.sent4: His vagabondish attitude towards life often landed him in unexpected situations.
meanings.sent5: The artist's vagabondish lifestyle inspired her unique and unconventional artworks.

meanings.definition: In the manner of a vagabond.
meanings.sent1: She wandered vagabondishly through the streets, taking in the sights and sounds of the city.
meanings.sent2: The children played vagabondishly in the park, running around without a care in the world.
meanings.sent3: The wind blew vagabondishly, scattering leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts in his mind drifted vagabondishly from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed vagabondishly, meandering through the countryside at its own pace.
